interface.name: LeastSquaresOptimizer
interface.javadoc:
An algorithm that can be applied to a non-linear least squares problem.
$Id: LeastSquaresOptimizer.java 1569362 2014-02-18 14:33:49Z luc $
3.3

Solve the non-linear least squares problem.
leastSquaresProblem the problem definition, including model function and convergence criteria.
The optimum.

interface.name: Optimum
interface.javadoc: The optimum found by the optimizer. This object contains the point, its value, and some metadata.

Get the number of times the model was evaluated in order to produce this optimum.
the number of model (objective) function evaluations

Get the number of times the algorithm iterated in order to produce this optimum. In general least squares it is common to have one {@link #getEvaluations() evaluation} per iterations.
the number of iterations
